intro: Callicarpa acuminata var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It features small, clustered flowers that transition into vibrant purple to red berries in the fall. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. It thrives in partial to full shade and is often found in moist woodland areas. The berries are a food source for birds and are also used in traditional medicine.
